actualResults.title: Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) - Unauthorized Access to Hidden Challenge xss3
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - This is a valid and distinct vulnerability from the expected XSS finding. The IDOR represents a separate authorization bypass issue where the /xss3 endpoint is accessible via direct URL manipulation without proper backend authorization checks. This is a different vulnerability class (authorization) than the expected XSS finding (input validation).

actualResults.title: Reflected XSS via Event Handler Injection in Name Parameter
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - This XSS vulnerability on the /xss25 endpoint was not expected. While it's XSS-related to the same application, it targets a different endpoint (/xss25 vs /xss3) and demonstrates the same insufficient filtering issue across multiple challenge endpoints. This represents broader application-wide XSS vulnerability.

actualResults.title: Information Disclosure - Server Technology Fingerprinting via HTTP Headers
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - Valid information disclosure vulnerability. The application reveals Werkzeug/3.1.3 and Python/3.13.3 versions in Server headers, which was not included in the expected findings. This is a separate vulnerability class (information disclosure) than the expected XSS finding.

actualResults.title: Missing Security Headers - X-Frame-Options, CSP, X-Content-Type-Options, X-XSS-Protection, and HSTS Not Set
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - Valid security misconfiguration vulnerability. The application lacks critical security headers on all endpoints. This was not in the expected findings and represents a separate vulnerability class (security header misconfiguration) that complements/amplifies the XSS vulnerabilities.

actualResults.title: Information Disclosure - Missing CSS File References Reveal Challenge Architecture
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - Valid information disclosure vulnerability. 404 responses on non-existent CSS files reveal application architecture and challenge structure. This was not in the expected findings and represents a separate reconnaissance aid vulnerability.

matched.expectedTitle: Reflected XSS via Insufficient Script Tag Filtering
matched.actualTitle: SVG-based Context Breakout XSS in XSS Challenge #3 + Reflected XSS via Event Handler Injection in /xss3 Endpoint
matched.matchReason: Both describe XSS vulnerabilities on the /xss3 endpoint resulting from incomplete input filtering. The expected finding describes insufficient regex filtering that can be bypassed; the actual findings confirm this by demonstrating multiple bypass methods: HTML entity encoding of < and > characters (%3C, %3E) to bypass the literal character filter, and event handler injection through attribute breakout. While the specific bypass mechanism differs (entity encoding vs. case-variation), both represent the same root cause: insufficient/incomplete XSS filtering on /xss3 that allows arbitrary script execution.
